title: Dorset and Hampshire Live: Friday 9 December - BBC News
summary: afc bournemouth to start search for new ground .
southern rail passengers warned of `` severely reduced '' service .
campaigners hand in petition over weymouth beach dog ban .
condor 's ferry liberation back in service after maintenance service .
saints crash out of europe after 1-1 draw .

documents.title: southampton 1-0 middlesbrough
text: southampton 1-0 middlesbrough
author: Michael Emons
BBC Sport

documents.title: burnley 3-2 bournemouth
text: burnley 3-2 bournemouth
author: Matt Davis
BBC Sport

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: that 's it for today - follow the news , sport , weather and travel throughout the weekend on bbc hampshire and bbc dorset .
we 'll back at 8:00 on monday

documents.title: seal-ly good news
text: two common seals have been released back into sea at poole harbour , following care at the rspca west hatch wildlife centre in taunton .
both seals arrived at the centre in august .
one was found at archirondel beach , jersey..
it had been orphaned and weighed about 11kg ( 24lb ) on admission , but 40kg ( 88lb ) on release , the rspca and dorset wildlife trust ( dwt ) said .
the other seal was found at chapman 's pool , near swanage , with a badly infected mouth and weighed just 8.7kg ( 19lb ) , but was released weighing 36kg ( 79lb ) .
dwt hopes to monitor the seals through its dorset seal project .

documents.title: austin out for boro clash
text: southampton top scorer charlie austin is out of sunday 's premier league match against middlesbrough after suffering a shoulder injury in the 1-1 draw against hapoel beer sheva .
dusan tadic returned from injury as a substitute in that match , while jay rodriguez and sofiane boufal have recovered from slight injuries .
it 's important to come back with conviction and get moving again in the premier league .
i have a lot of respect for middlesbrough .
they play good football , with good pressing and organisation . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: poole sickness bug school 'closed until tuesday '
text: a dorset school that has been closed because of a sickness bug is not expected to reopen until tuesday amid health and safety fears .
pupils at turlin moors community school in poole started to become ill a week ago .
the school , for four to 11 year olds , closed on wednesday and reopened on thursday , but has now been shut again to allow a `` deep clean '' to take place , a spokeswoman said .
she added it was `` difficult to tell '' how many people had been affected by the outbreak .

documents.title: cherries stadium : council offers support
text: bournemouth council has issued a statement , following the news that afc bournemouth is searching for a new stadium site .
cherries chief executive neill blake said the club was `` working closely with bournemouth borough council to identify a suitable location '' .
the local authority has said it will do `` all that we can '' to help .
like everyone , we are extremely proud of the achievements of afc bournemouth and we recognise the importance of the club to both local residents and fans .
we will continue to support the club and do all that we can to help in their search for potential sites .
we will of course be seeking to ensure that the needs of the club are met alongside those of the local community , and within established planning policy .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: hawk sought after squirrel attacks
text: a non-indigenous bird of prey which is believed to have killed red squirrels on the isle of wight is frustrating efforts to capture it .
the red tailed hawk escaped from a private owner and is known to have killed at least two of the island 's protected population of red squirrels .
falconer steven hain appealed for help from local residents in the seaview area to report sightings .
we 've been going for several months - we 've tried all sorts - bait , traps , literally running after it through the countryside to try and tire it out .
we 've tried everything possible .
it does n't belong here .
our nature is n't designed to cope with the red-tailed hawk out there .
i do n't want to see any bird of prey shot , that would be a last resort . ''
author: Stephen Stafford
BBC South

documents.title: strike-hit rail firm in legal appeal
text: strike-hit rail firm in legal appeal

documents.title: b & b warning for homeless families
text: five families , including seven children , could be spending christmas in b & bs because of a shortage of affordable rented accommodation in purbeck , the district council says .
government figures show rising numbers of households are living in b & bs across the country , even though the government has said they are `` particularly unsuitable '' for families .
purbeck council said the issue was an increasing financial burden , because it was not allowed to reclaim the costs of b & b placements .
unless we are able to provide more affordable rented accommodation moving into temporary bed and breakfast accommodation will become a real possibility for more purbeck families .

documents.title: sophie the cockapoo found safe and well
text: yesterday we told you about a woman who had her handbag and her dog stolen while she was being treated by paramedics in bournemouth .
police launched an appeal - and sophie the cockapoo was subsequently found this afternoon - outside hamworthy library in poole .
no arrests have been made , however enquiries are continuing .

documents.title: police thank public for dog leads
text: police said they had recieved a number of leads after putting out an appeal for sophie the stolen cockapoo .
she was found this afternoon left on its own outside hamworthy library in poole .
the dog had been micro-chipped and was confirmed to be missing dog sophie .
the public 's response to my appeal has been overwhelming and all the help we have received is very much appreciated .
without the public 's help it would not have been possible to reunite the dog with its owner .
it 's great to know that sophie will be spending christmas at home with her family . ''

documents.title: burnley v bournemouth team news
text: bournemouth left-back charlie daniels is fit for the cherries ' trip to burnley after a hip problem , but junior stanislas is out with an ankle injury .
fellow midfielder andrew surman is still sidelined by a hamstring problem .
`` i really enjoyed my time at burnley .
i 'm very , very fond of the town , the people who work at the club and the players we worked with who are still there .
but it 's a game for bournemouth and we need to get as many points as we can .
i think burnley are a good side and i do n't see them being in any trouble this year , they 've got more than enough resilience . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: portsmouth tro butterfly house awarded £ 130k for rebuild
text: plans for a new tro butterfly house at a natural history museum in portsmouth have been awarded£ 130,000 .

proposals for cumberland house include demolishing the current 1980s butterfly house , restoring original features at the rear of the museum , and building a new structure `` with a better environment for butterflies and visitors '' , the city council , which has provided the funding , said .
the authority said the current building was `` beyond economic repair , and not suitable for housing butterflies '' .
the total cost of the rebuild is expected to be £ 150,000 .
once completed it is hoped the new building will house about 100 south american native butterflies during the season - which means 50 hatching per week .

documents.title: £ 100,000 cocaine seizure in petersfield
text: cocaine with an estimated street value of £ 100,000 has been seized after police stopped a car in petersfield .
officers found the drugs in the vehicle and at a local address on wednesday .
james lawrence , 30 , of stakes road , waterlooville has been charged with possession with intent to supply cocaine .

documents.title: condor ferries : punctuality statistics released
text: condor has released their latest statistics , detailing what percentage of crossings were cancelled or delayed .
the results , which compare sailing from july to november in comparison to last year , show a slight improvement
author: Chris Quevatre
BBC News Online

documents.title: watch : taxis being used to take people to hospital
text: watch : taxis being used to take people to hospital

documents.title: condor liberation : look back on a difficult first year in service
text: as condor liberation returns to service after its annual dry dock we look back on the vessel 's difficult first year in service .
27 march - first sailing from poole after three months of sea trials
28 march - suffered minor damage to protective belting while mooring in bad weather in st peter port
5 april - returned to service after delays to repairs caused by poor weather
8 april - sailings from guernsey to jersey cancelled because of a recurring electrical fault in an engine
11 april - problems with a ramp for loading vehicles delayed a crossing from poole by 40 minutes
9 may - services on liberation day , after which the vessel was named , were cancelled after problems with one of its two bow-thrusters
18 september - problems with the exhaust system led to cancellations and delays
31 december - vessel damaged while moored in poole harbour during a storm and was out for the whole of january for repairs
26 february - steering problems led to the cancellation of sailings for three days
16 march - the ferry is detained in poole after safety issues were found during an inspection
19 march - liberation returned to service after a further safety inspection
author: Ben Chapple
BBC News Online

documents.title: man arrested over school burglaries
text: a 21-year-old man has been arrested by police investigating a spate of burglaries and attempted break-ins at schools and nurseries in southampton .
laptops , a tool-kit and charity collection money were among items stolen in raids on nine premises which started on 22 november .
in the latest incident , sinclair nursery and primary school was broken into at about 21:30 gmt on wednesday .

documents.title: toilet visits 'life-threatening '
text: gosport sailor alex thomson says he is enduring `` extremely bumpy '' sea conditions , as he passes the halfway stage in the vendee globe race .
thomson , who has been tussling for the lead with french sailor armel le cleac'h , says he struggles to walk around the boat and cooking is `` virtually impossible '' .

documents.title: jury retires in former teacher sex abuse case
text: a jury has retired to consider its verdict in the case of a 76-year-old former teacher accused of sexually assaulting young girls at the hampshire school where he worked in the 1970s .
timothy bleach , of hazel walks , petersfield , is alleged to have carried out assaults at weyford junior school in bordon .
mr bleach denies 62 counts , covering more than 100 incidents , including rape .
his trial began more than four weeks ago at portsmouth crown court .

documents.title: weymouth man wanted for recall to prison
text: members of the public have been warned by police not to approach a weymouth man who is wanted for breaching his licence conditions .
shaun lewis , 24 , was serving a three-year sentence for causing grievous bodily harm when he was released from prison in september 2015 .
he breached his licence on 7 october this year , and is now wanted for recall to prison , dorset police said .
he is described as white , 5ft 9in , of medium build and has short brown hair and sometimes has a beard .
he is also has links with bournemouth and poole .

documents.title: school closure 'due to norovirus '
text: turlin moor community school in poole is shut today for a `` deep clean '' following an outbreak of norovirus , it has been reported .
school shuts for deep clean after norovirus outbreak

documents.title: schoolboy 's campaign sees hero 's medals remain in uk
text: eachan hardie from dorchester has been telling radio solent 's steve harris about his campaign to save the medals and log book of war hero capt .
eric `` winkle '' brown .
eachan , 11 , began writing to the legendary pilot two years ago for advice on how to follow in his footsteps .
capt brown died in february , aged 97 , and his medals and log book were due to be sold .
but eachan launched a campaign to keep them in the country which ended with the collection being acquired by the fleet air arm museum in somerset .
we met up with 11 year old eachan hardie from dorset who launched a campaign to save the war medals of the royal navy 's most decorated pilot

documents.title: bournemouth reveal plan for new stadium
text: bournemouth reveal plan for new stadium

documents.title: watch : wildlife parks impose bird flu restrictions
text: watch : wildlife parks impose bird flu restrictions

documents.title: tranmere sign pompey winger tollitt
text: tranmere sign pompey winger tollitt

documents.title: funding offered for dorset community-run buses
text: match-funding of up to £ 5,000 is being offered to communities in dorset that organise their own bus schemes .
the council has agreed the cash as it moves to cut a further £ 1m from its public transport subsidy budget next year .
in february , councillors reduced the overall budget for supported transport by about £ 1.5m .
campaigners have previously said the cuts will isolate people in rural areas .

documents.title: austin ruled out for saints
text: southampton striker charlie austin , who was injured in last night 's draw against hapoel beer sheva , is out of contention for sunday 's visit by middlesborough .
but saints manager claude puel hopes to have jay rodriguez and sofiane boufal available .
puel : `` it 's a disappointment for @ twitterid but it 's important for the team to have a good answer . ''
# saintsfc

documents.title: power cut in dorchester
text: the power supply in part of dorchester is off , after workers on a building site damaged two cables yesterday .
power firm sse says it has switched off supplies to 120 customers until about 14:30 gmt to carry out repairs .
the affected area includes part of high west street and some dorset county council offices , but the authority says services to the public are not affected .

documents.title: breakingcherries to start search for new ground
text: afc bournemouth have confirmed they intend to build a new stadium in a new location .
the club 's current home at the 11,450-capacity vitality stadium is leased from property company structadene .
chief executive neill blake said the club would `` not be held to ransom '' over a price to purchase the ground or `` develop a ground they do not own '' .
bournemouth , in their second top flight season , hope to have a new stadium built in time for the 2020-21 season .

documents.title: stanislas absent for cherries
text: bournemouth manager eddie howe says winger junior stanislas faces a spell out of action , after being injured in last week 's victory over liverpool .
the manager has arrived for his pre- @ burnleyofficial press conference # afcb
eh : `` junior stanislas will be out .
fingers crossed it wo n't be too long for him - weeks rather than months .
charlie daniels is available . ''
eh : `` beating a top team like liverpool should give us a boost .
we 've tried not to focus on it too much , but there 's a spring in the step . ''
eh : `` @ nathanake 's versatility was key in our reasoning to sign him .
he 's really looking the part right now . ''
eh : `` we see nathan as a player we 'd like to play in the middle of the pitch , but again he is very versatile . ''
eh : `` i 've got good memories from my time at burnley .
the club were in transition at that time , but the staff and people were great . ''
eh : `` it was a period when i was out of my comfort zone , but also a time in which i learned a lot as a manager . ''
eh : `` the challenge here is to now build consistency .
i do n't think we 've put a proper marker down yet , so that 's what we 've got to do . ''
eh : `` sean dyche has done a wonderful job .
i think they 'll have more than enough to stay up .
they 're a team really playing for their boss . ''
eh : `` it 's good for @ twitterid to get the recognition his form deserves .
he 's had a big impact on games for us and is only improving . ''
that 's it from the manager this morning .
full press conference video to be available on cherries playerhd later today .
# afcb
@ twitterid that fraser guy is good mate
fraser take his place

documents.title: not 'trainy mctrainface '
text: a model train , built by eastleigh mens shed voluntary group , has been installed at chandlers ford station .
the smiling engine will be filled with plants in the spring to brighten up the area .
the three rivers community partnership is inviting suggestions for names for the installation , although 'trainy mctrainface ' has already been rejected .

text: dog owners present beach petition

text: watch : condor liberation in dry dock

documents.title: acclaim for cancer blog
text: congratulations @ twitterid - mum who blogs about family cancer battle nominated for award
thank you so much

text: funding offered for community-run buses

documents.title: southern : mp calls for change in the law
text: a sussex mp says the government should consider a change in the law to stop crippling rail strikes from happening in the future .
author: Kathryn Langley
BBC Live reporter

documents.title: dog owners present beach petition
text: campaigners hoping to overturn new rules banning dogs from weymouth 's beach for up to seven months of the year will be handing a petition to the council later .
weymouth and portland borough council extended the amount of time that dogs were not allowed on the beach for an extra six to nine weeks a year .
the petition , launched by resident judi moore , has been signed by 1,150 people .
ms moore said she hoped it would be debated by the council in january .

documents.title: condor liberation : no structural work during service
text: the dry dock of condor liberation has involved a `` large amount of routine work '' and `` no structural work '' .
captain fran collins , from condor ferries , said : `` what we have been doing is inspecting the areas of the ship we ca n't do during normal service .
`` either because of time constrains or for example bits that are under the water like the water jets , the steering rams the hull itself . ''
author: BBC Channel Islands News

documents.title: academy teacher laid to rest
text: the oasis academy , mayfield , was closed on thursday , for the funeral of pastoral leader calvin rodgers who died suddenly last month .
almost a thousand people pay their respects to popular southampton teacher calvin rodgers

documents.title: condor liberation : what 's been done ?
text: the condor liberation has been in dry dock in falmouth for nearly a month , but today comes back into service .
we 've been taking a look at what 's been done to the ship that 's had its fair share of problems since the launch in 2015
author: BBC Channel Islands News

documents.title: teenager killed while 'running across a303 '
text: a drunken teenager died as he ran across the a303 dual carriageway near andover in september and was hit by a motorhome , an inquest has heard .
harry butler , 18 , was killed in front of two friends , one of whom remains in hospital with `` life-changing injuries '' , the hearing in winchester was told .
police have refused to comment on newspaper reports that on the day before the crash , the teenager had been told he would not be prosecuted for the attempted murder of a love rival .
recording a verdict of death caused by a road accident , the coroner grahame short said the tragedy had `` affected many lives '' .

documents.title: seafront road closed
text: dudley road , ventnor will be closed between 09:00 to 15:30 for carriageway repairs

documents.title: inside southampton 's new leisure hub
text: southampton 's new £ 85m leisure development , westquay watermark , opened yesterday , with the first of `` about 20 '' restaurants receiving customers .
photos : get a glimpse inside southampton 's newly-opened £ 85million leisure centre

documents.title: dozens of suspects in football abuse inquiry
text: there are now 83 potential suspects and 98 clubs involved in the inquiry into child abuse in football , police chiefs have said .
the investigations span all tiers of football , `` from premier clubs through to amateur '' , the national police chiefs ' council ( npcc ) said .
police forces across the country are continuing to receive calls , it added .
the npcc 's lead for child protection said the allegations were `` being swiftly acted upon '' by police .

documents.title: men charged after boy injured by motorbikes
text: two men have been charged by police after a six-year-old boy was seriously injured in a collision involving two motorcycles .
the boy was walking in london road , andover , on 17 july , when he was struck .
nathan crocker , 24 , of penton grafton , is accused of five offences including causing serious injury by dangerous driving and failing to stop .
damian wernham , 23 , of dene court , andover , is charged with dangerous driving and two other motoring offences .
the men are due before basingstoke magistrates on 22 december .

documents.title: sickness bug closes poole school
text: a school in poole has been closed today due to a sickness bug .
a message on turlin moor community school 's website reads : `` due to continuous sickness in the school , for health and safety reasons the school is closed today . ''
the bbc has contacted the school for more information .

documents.title: 'severe ' disruption on southern railway
text: beleaguered southern rail passengers have been warned services will be `` severely reduced '' today following three days of strike action .
the latest strike by rmt members in the long-running dispute over the role of conductors on trains ended at midnight .
meanwhile , drivers from the aslef union are continuing with their overtime ban .

documents.title: the man who fought to have his leg amputated
text: the man who fought to have his leg amputated

documents.title: liberation returns to service after dry dock service
text: as the condor liberation returns to service operating between poole and the channel islands we take a look behind the scenes of its time in the dry dock in falmouth .
the three-week service has involved :
author: Neil Gallacher, Business & Industry Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: good morning
text: good morning and welcome to the bbc local live service on friday .
we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport and travel throughout the day .
you can get in touch via email , on our hampshire and dorset facebook pages or on twitter @ bbc hampshire and @ bbcdorset .
